Module com.example.c482_project
Package code.Controllers

Class MainScreenController

java.lang.Object
code.Controllers.MainScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the class for the Main Screen. All the methods and data in here are related to the tables, fields, and buttons.

  • Method Details

    • handleExitButtonAction

      public void handleExitButtonAction()
      This method closes the application completely.

    • handleAddPartButtonAction

      public void handleAddPartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This is the method that handles the add part button click. When this button is clicked. It generates the "Add Part" window. RUNTIME ERROR: Location not set. I fixed this error by correcting the path to the "AddPart.fxml".
      Parameters:
      event - this is the event that calls this method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the window cannot open an exception is created and reported.

    • handleModifyPartButtonAction

      public void handleModifyPartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This is the handler for the modify button under the parts table view. When the modify button is clicked, the selected object data will be passed to the "Modify Part" window, and that window is opened.
      Parameters:
      event - the action that called the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs, it is thrown.

    • handleAddProductsButtonAction

      public void handleAddProductsButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the handler for the add button below the products table view. When the add button is clicked, the "Add Product" window is generated and opened, and the "Main Screen" window is closed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that called the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an exception occurs, it is thrown.

    • handleModifyProductsButtonAction

      public void handleModifyProductsButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the handler for the modify button under the products table view. When the modify button is clicked, the selected product data is sent to the "Modify Product" window, and the window is opened, and this window is closed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action that called this method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an exception occurs, it is thrown.

    • handleDeletePartButtonAction

      public void handleDeletePartButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the handler for the delete button under the parts table view. When the delete button is clicked, a confirmation window appears, if the user clicks ok, the selected part is deleted from the observable array list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that called this method.

    • handleDeleteProductsButtonAction

      public void handleDeleteProductsButtonAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the handler for the delete button under the products table view. When the delete button is clicked, the method checks if the product has associated parts, if it doesn't, the part is deleted from the observable array list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action that called the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an exception occurs, it is thrown.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This is the initialize method. It populates the parts table view, and product table view.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the url.
      resourceBundle - the resource bundle.

    • handlePartLookup

      public void handlePartLookup(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the handler for the search field above the parts table view. When this handler is called the table view is updated with the found data, if it doesn't find any, an information window shows up.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that called the method.

    • handleProductLookup

      public void handleProductLookup(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This is the handler for the search field above the product table view. When this method is called, is populates the products table view with the found results. If it finds nothing, an information window appears.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the action that called this method.
